trial_identification.studytitle: Prediction of Dysplasia Within Sessile Serrated Polyps Using Endoscopic Imaging; a Prospective Observational Study
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Prediction of Dysplasia Within Sessile Serrated Polyps Using Endoscopic Imaging; a Prospective Observational Study

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Bowel - Back passage (rectum) or large bowel (colon)

interventions.interventions:
Diagnosis / Prognosis - Endoscopic imaging
Study population - Patients referred to a tertiary endoscopic resection practice found to have an SSP >= 8mm. Endoscopic imaging applied to the sessile serrated polyp (SSP) to determine the presence or absence of dysplasia.
Diagnosis / Prognosis: Endoscopic imaging Analysis of the presence of dysplasia within sessile serrated polyps (SSP) using endoscopic imaging (high definition white light +- narrow band imaging)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Dysplasia - Presence of dysplasia within sessile serrated polyps (SSP) using endoscopic imaging and congruence with histopathology
primaryOutcome.timepoint: at the initial procedure when the sessile serrated polyp (SSP) is analysed by the endoscopist compared with when the SSP is analysed at histopathology less than one week later. no ongoing determination

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Sessile serrated polyp - Determination of a specific polyp as an sessile serrated polyp (SSP)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at the initial procedure compared with histopathology within 1 week. no ongoing determination

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: - Patients referred to a tertiary endoscopic resection practice with any sessile serrated polyp (SSP) >= 8mm
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: - Patients referred to a tertiary endoscopic resection practice without sessile serrated polyps (SSP)

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Study of endoscopic imaging in the detection of dysplasia within serrated colonic lesions >= 8mm in size
